campaignPreset.title: 1 - New Player Preset
campaignPreset.description:
This preset is a simplified version of the "Veteran Experience" preset, designed for newer players or those seeking an easier game.

Most options remain enabled, but some of the more punishing or complex systems have been disabled. The idea is that you can enable them one-by-one as you grow more experienced with the program.

This preset is recommended for new MekHQ players, or those returning from an extended break.

Differences from Veteran Preset

  • Easier maintenance and repairs.
  • Lower tech level, for a more streamlined experience.
  • Easier and quicker procurement.
  • Planetary Acquisitions disabled.
  • Slightly higher contract pay.
  • The effects of aging, disabled.
  • Easier healing.
  • No prisoner management.
  • Easier employee turnover, with both Management Skill and Unit Cohesion disabled.
  • Fatigue disabled.
  • Maternity Leave disabled.
  • Cheaper monthly expenses.
  • Free recruitment.
  • Gray Monday effects disabled.
  • Taxes disabled.
  • Instant unit purchase deliveries.
  • Reduced scenario difficulty.
  • Auto-Resolve shows chances of success.
  • Easier procurement while on contract.

ability.desc: Nightwalker ignores all darkness move penalties when using Walk / Cruise movement but does not affect gunnery modifiers for lighting conditions.
A pilot who specializes in a particular weapon receives a -2 to hit modifier on all attacks with that weapon.
Foot Infantry gain 1 extra MP and allows for foot infantry to move and shoot when using two support weapons.
The Target Number of all Acting and Negotiation checks are decreased by 1.
A small pilot can use small and cramped cockpits without problems.
Unit has -1 bonus against designated target, +2 penalty against all others; lasts until target retreats, can only be used once per battle.
Pilot has a +1 penalty for physical attacks, because clans do not train for dishonourable combat.
Range modifiers are swapped with short range (Medium, Long, or Extreme).

Increases the cost of purchasing and improving Skills by 20% (rounded normally).
If XP adjustments from a high or low Reasoning are enabled, those adjustments are additive. So a 20% increase from this SPA and a 5% decrease from Reasoning would equal a 15% increase.
The Target Number of Art/Any, Cryptography, Demolitions, Investigation, Protocols, Security Systems/Any, Strategy, Tactics and Training checks is increased by 1.

Is violently ill following a hyperspace jump.
They increase the Target Number of Piloting and Gunnery checks by 1 for 48 hours following the jump (Advanced Medical only).
They also gain Fatigue based on the campaign options fatigue rate (default 1).
Movement in rubble or rough cost 1 less MP and elevation changes also cost 1 MP less. The mountaineer also receives a -1 to PSR checks for the given terrain.
The Target Number of all Acting and Negotiation checks are increased by 1.
Enables the unit to do one additional kick, punch, or club attack on the same opponent.
All injuries suffered are reduced by 25% and Fatigue gain is halved. Fatigue gain from sustaining injuries is not halved.

The character cannot be poisoned.
Mechanically, this offers few benefits; however, the character will be completely immune to the Fatigue gain from the 'Poisoning' Prisoner Event.

Decreases the cost of purchasing and improving Skills by 20% (rounded normally).
If XP adjustments from a high or low Reasoning are enabled, those adjustments are additive. So a 20% decrease from this SPA and a 5% increase from Reasoning would equal a 15% decrease.
You can do more damage with two-handed physical attacks at the risk of damaging yourself.
A pilot with this ability does not suffer the initial -1 to hit due to weather conditions.
Decreases Charisma Attribute by 1 (may not take it below 1).
Increases the Target Number for all Animal Handling checks by 2.
The Target Number of all Perception checks is decreased by 1.

Urban Guerrilla gives infantry a better chance of survival in urban or suburban environments (+1 to be hit) It also keeps them from taking double damage in the open when in pavement or road terrain types. Finally, urban guerrillas can call on local support once per scenario.
Movement in mud or swamp costs 1 less MP. Using run/flank MP while in mud/swamp gives +1 BTH when being attacked
Recover from injuries at twice the normal rate (Advanced Medical only).

Characters can only increase their Attributes up to a maximum determined by their Phenotype.
This SPA increases that maximum by 1, but does not increase the Attribute itself.
Ground units have a harder time hitting this airborne target. Attacking units get a +1 tohit penalty

Decreases Charisma Attribute by 3 (may not take it below 1).
The Target Number of all Perception checks decreased by 1 due to improved hearing.
A pilot with this ability gets a +4, +3, or +2 to the cluster table at short, medium, or long/extended range, respectively, but only with a specialized weapon.
The Target Number of all Perception checks is increased by 1.
When making consciousness rolls, 1 is added to all rolls. Also, damage received from ammo explosions is reduced to 1. Note: This ability is only used for BattleMeks.
A pilot with this ability does not suffer the initial -1 to hit due to darkness.

Characters can only increase their Attributes up to a maximum determined by their Phenotype.
This SPA increases that maximum by 1, but does not increase the Attribute itself.
Ignore first point of penalty for repair and maintenance on low quality equipment.
The tech is slow and methodical at their work. They take a +1 penalty to their repair rolls, but are better at maintaining units than most, with a -1 bonus.
-2 on refit rolls.
A pilot who has a Tactical Genius may reroll their initiative once per turn. The second roll must be accepted. Note: Only one Tactical Genius may be utilized per team.
A pilot with this ability gets a -2 bonus on sensor checks. Note that this is really only a bonus, if inclusive sensor ranges are in use.

Characters can only increase their Attributes up to a maximum determined by their Phenotype.
This SPA increases that maximum by 1, but does not increase the Attribute itself.
Increases the target number of all Charisma-based skills by 2.
Doubles all Fatigue gain.
Removes the penalties from a single missing arm or hand (Advanced Medical only).
Ground attacks are easier. Strike gives -1 BTH and Bombing is -2. Also decreases scatter distance by 2 hexes
Unit only suffers a +1 to-hit penalty for jumping, rather than a +3 to-hit penalty.

-1 to repair and maintenance checks when working with internal systems</desc> <xpCost>100</xpCost> <weight>2</weight> <skillPrereq> <skill>Tech/Vessel::Regular</skill> <skill>Tech/Aero::Regular</skill> <skill>Tech/Mechanic::Regular</skill> <skill>Tech/Mek::Regular</skill> <skill>Tech/BattleArmor::Regular</skill> </skillPrereq> </ability> <ability> <lookupName>tech_engineer</lookupName> <displayName>Engineer (unofficial)</displayName> <desc><![CDATA[-2 on refit rolls.

Enables the unit to make a dodge maneuver instead of a physical attack. This maneuver adds +2 to the BTH to physical attacks against the unit. NOTE: The dodge maneuver is declared during the weapons phase. Note: This ability is only used for BattleMeks.
The Target Number of all Perception checks is decreased by 1.
Range penalties are halved.

Increases Charisma Attribute by 1 (may not take it above 10).
The Target Number of all Perception checks decreased by 1 due to improved hearing.

Characters can only increase their Attributes up to a maximum determined by their Phenotype.
This SPA increases that maximum by 1, but does not increase the Attribute itself.
Pilot gets a -1 to-hit bonus on all ballistic weapons (MGs, all ACs, Gauss rifles).
Roll 3d6 and take the best two for gunnery checks
-1 to repair and maintenance checks when working with armor.
A pilot with this ability does not suffer the PSR penalties due to weather.
Enables the unit to do 1 additional point of damage with physical attacks and applies a -1 to-hit modifier to physical attacks. Note: This ability is only used for BattleMeks.
The penalty for indirect fire is reduced by one and can also use indirect fire with out a spotter.
A pilot who specializes in a type of weapon receives a -1 to-hit modifier when using weapons of that type and a +1 to-hit modifier when using other types of weapons.
Pilot gets a -1 to-hit bonus on all missile weapons (LRM, SRM, MRM, RL and ATM).

The cost of purchasing and improving the Tech/Any, Computers, Communications, or Security Systems/Electronic skills is increased by 10% (rounded normally).
Furthermore, the Target Number of checks made with such skills is increased by 1.
Unit only suffers a +2 to-hit penalty for jumping, rather than a +3 to-hit penalty.
The Target Number of all Perception checks is increased by 1.

Allows a Quad Mek or ProtoMek, or a bipedal Mek or ProtoMek with the animalistic quirk, the following benefits. -1 MP per hex of Woods and Jungle terrain. In addition quads gain a -1 to any quad related PSR check. NOTE: The quirk should be used only on bipedal units that have an animal like appearance.
Allows a unit to use terrain normally restricted to said unit at the cost of increased MP.
Roll 3d6 and take the best two for piloting checks
NOTE: This is a unofficial rule. Pilot gets a -1 to-hit bonus on all energy-based weapons (Laser, PPC, Plasma and Flamer).
A pilot with this ability gets a +2 to the cluster hit table
Secondary target modifiers are reduced by one.

A low Reputation trait infers a penalty to Negotiation, Streetwise and Protocols skill checks. This SPA reduces that penalty by 2.
While this SPA does exist in ATOW (and that's where you'll find its description), these effects are unique to MekHQ.
Reduce heat-related target rolls (e.g ammo, damage, shutdown) by 1.
Environmental specialists are adept in certain planetary conditions. This gives the unit bonuses to PSR and movement penalties (halves MP / PSR) as well to hit rolls (-1).
Decreases Charisma Attribute by 3 (may not take it below 1).

Enables the unit to move laterally like a Quad. Quads can move laterally for 1 less MP. Aerospace units can perform maneuvers for 1 less thrust point. Units also receive a -1 BTH to rolls against skidding, sideslipping, and going out of control.
Reduces scatter distance by two hexes.
Increases Charisma Attribute by 1 (may not take it above 10).
Acts as an active probe or extends range of existing active probe. Also makes avoiding minefields easier
Movement in woods or jungle costs 1 less MP. Using walk/cruise MP while in woods/jungle gives +1 BTH when being attacked. Additionally, you gain -1 to PSR checks in Jungle terrain.
The Target Number of Art/Any, Cryptography, Demolitions, Investigation, Protocols, Security Systems/Any, Strategy, Tactics and Training checks is decreased by 1.
-1 to repair and maintenance checks when working with weapons.
All injuries suffered and fatigue gained is doubled. Fatigue gain from sustaining injuries is not doubled.

Increases Strength Attribute by 2 and maximum Strength by 1. Neither increase may take this Attribute above 10.
Increases the target number of all Charisma-based skills by 2 due to inhumanly shaped bulk.
Improves the accuracy of your artillery. Fire Adjustment gets a -2 modifier. Spotting gets an additional -1 tohit modifier for each point of gunnery below 4.

The Human TRO has studied a given type of battlefield unit giving the pilot a bonus when rolling for critical hit. This applies a +1 when determining criticals for a specific unit type (Mek, Aero, etc.)
Decreases the target number of all Charisma-based skills by 2.
Decreases the Target Number for all Animal Handling checks by 2.
Half all Fatigue gained (rounding down).
A pilot with this skill receives only 1 pilot hit from ammunition explosions.

Unit Reputation is increased by 1 if this character is the campaign commander.
A pilot who has Combat Sense rolls three dice per initiative check, keeping the top two rolls.
If individual initiative is enabled, this bonus applies only to the pilot's unit. Otherwise, the bonus is applied only if the pilot's unit is the force commander.
The Target Number of all Perception checks are decreased by 3.
A pilot with this ability gets a +1 to the cluster hit table
A pilot with this ability does not suffer the initial -1 to hit due to heat.

Characters can only increase their Attributes up to a maximum determined by their Phenotype.
This SPA increases that maximum by 1, but does not increase the Attribute itself.
Movement in depth 2 or greater water costs 1 MP less. Also grants -1 to all PSR checks (including physicals) as well as -2 to Crush Depth checks.

Unit Reputation is decreased by 1 if this character is the campaign commander.
A pilot who has Combat Sense rolls three dice per initiative check, keeping the top two rolls.
If individual initiative is enabled, this penalty applies only to the pilot's unit. Otherwise, the penalty is applied only if the pilot's unit is the force commander.

The cost of purchasing and improving the Tech/Any, Computers, Communications, or Security Systems/Electronic skills is decreased by 10% (rounded normally).
Furthermore, the Target Number of checks made with such skills is decreased by 1.

Characters can only increase their Attributes up to a maximum determined by their Phenotype.
This SPA increases that maximum by 1, but does not increase the Attribute itself.
